---
description: 'Documentation file conventions'
applyTo: 'docs/**/*.md, *.md'
---

# Documentation Instructions

Apply these conventions to all Markdown documentation:

## Structure
- Use descriptive headings with emoji prefixes where appropriate
- Include table of contents for files > 100 lines
- Use code blocks with language specifiers

## Code Examples
- All Python code blocks should be syntax highlighted
- Include realistic examples from the actual codebase
- Show both correct ✅ and incorrect ❌ patterns

## API Documentation
- Document all parameters with types
- Show request and response examples
- Include error scenarios

## Formatting
- Use tables for structured data
- Use admonitions for important notes
- Keep lines under 100 characters

## Links
- Use relative links to other docs files
- Link to source code with line numbers when relevant

## Language
- Primary language: Russian for user guides
- Technical docs: English or bilingual
- Code comments: English only
